title: New version of Apple TV with Siri unveiled
text: New version of Apple TV with Siri unveiled RELATED Apple investors hope for stock boost NEW DELHI: Apple has taken a step towards making the TV the next big category for the company with a major revamp of its set-top box. The new Apple TV not only gets Siri integration and dedicated app store and more powerful hardware, the device will get an operating system of its own, named tvOS. CEO Tim Cook emphasized the importance of Apple TV and native apps, saying, "Our vision for TV is simple and perhaps a little provocative. We believe the future of television is apps." Users will be able to interact with the new Apple TV using Siri as well as the remote control. Cook showed a video where Siri can pull up relevant movies in iTunes when asked questions like "Show me family movies," "Comedies with Jason Bateman," etc. Apple TV with come integrated iTunes, HBO, Hulu, Showtime integration. Siri will be able perform tasks like skipping back a few seconds if you miss a scene while watching a video, Apple said at the event. You will be able to watch two videos at the same time as the device supports split-screen view. Siri on Apple TV will also be able to deliver sports scores, weather etc. The device will also come with gaming apps like Galaxy on Fire and Guitar Hero, and Shadowmatic. For connectivity, the new Apple TV will have Ethernet, HDMI and Bluetooth 4.0. Apple said that the basic 32GB Apple TV m0del will cost $149, whereas the 64GB variant will cost $199, and will start shipping in 80 countries starting October.
